availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Vanderen Waits in Harrison County, Kentucky, on September 5, 1839. Father of Mary Waits, James H. Waits, John L. Waits, Margaret A. Waits, and Alfred Waits. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 101B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 361.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 613.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 125B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896, p. 82.
"Richard Waits (1801-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial #157011769, accessed January 26, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/157011769.
